intro: Riedlea supina, commonly known as the prostrate riedlea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and economically important plants. The plant typically grows in a prostrate or creeping manner, with slender stems that root at the nodes. Its small, white or pale yellow flowers are clustered in umbels, and it produces small, elliptical berries. Riedlea supina is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth or along stream banks.
